comments.body: It's not useless, it is interesting and aesthetically appealing, which in and of itself is a form of use.
Use JCM Pr0
Copper needs air to turn green water is a slower option unless it’s saltwater!

I agree to this. In real life, the oxidation of copper is a simple chemical reaction, of 2Cu + O2 -> 2CuO, or 4Cu + O2 -> 2CuO2. Water, or H2O, is a catalyst for this, meaning that water speeds up the reaction without being consumed in the process. If Minecraft is going for semi-realism, then this should absolutely be a thing, so here's my idea:

1.) Firstly, let's say that the odds of copper progressing a stage is 1 in 100, rather high, but good for comparrison purposes. IF a water source block is adjacent to the copper block, the odds should be increased to along the lines of 1 in 10, and lesser water levels should also have an increase in the chance, though not as much.

2.) Secondly, it's a similar case for the rain. The reason that the Statue of Liberty is a green color is because of the oxidation by  rain, so they should absolutely raise the odds of copper oxidizing a state during the rain.

3.) Thirdly, going along the lines of a similar chemical reaction, I think there should be a way to de-oxidize Copper as well, as this could take use of copper's electrical properties. I purpose that if you place a powered redstone repeater going directly into the copper block, the effects of the oxidation will begin to undo themselves.
I think this would be great for people who want to build with copper early game. Right now, copper takes a while to oxidize (which I think is awesome) but stops you from using it early on.
This should also include Copper golems aswell for people struggle to patiently wait for them to oxidize

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.

Title: “Attack Performance”

Text: “It is very difficult to kill several mobs at once, there is already a future on the PC, where a charged attack can be used to carry out a swing attack that can hit several monsters within a short range. It is very useful for exp farms and multiple mobs. I also see no reason not to include such a future. I ask for your help in getting this implemented. Thank you for reading it and you will succeed.”

- Translated by Admin

That's interesting - did you have a suggestion on how this may be handled? Thanks!
364023375071  Maybe make the player throw a potion of harming or slowness at the witch?
I think it means that you use a splash potion that harms the witch. For instance, a healing potion will harm a witch and a regeneration potion would poison it.

392729187031  Witches aren't undead though, so they aren't harmed my potions of healing, otherwise, why would they drink potions of instant health? To kill themselves? Also, the achievement clearly states you have to poison a witch, not harm one. Even if a witch was an undead mob, which it is DEFINITLY NOT, undead mobs are immune to potions of regeneration anyway. So, the only real way to poison a witch is to throw a potion of decay at it, which, ironically, can only be found in witch huts in survival.
